column4: good news guys. this is my first time running alternate cd and the installation is going a lot further than with the destkop cd. I am so happy!!!!

guys, the text installer is asking me how i want to partiton the disk. which option should i choose? I want to remove the WinXP which is the 1 and only hard drive and let ubuntu take over teh entire hard drive
choice 1: resize scsi 3, partiotn 1 and use freed space ...
choice 3 use the lagret continous free space
Here we go. No turning back
No more windows on the computer from now on
the text installer is now asking me : "is system clock set to UTC". What should I say?\
If you won't have windows in the system, it is practical to use UTC in the BIOS clock.
You can set the clock later by using ntpdate.
But if the time is already in localtine, you may prefer to say no.
The problem I see is that you are already into installation.
In the end, it doesn't really matter, (unless you want to install NetBSD in another partition, that one is a doozy).
So, just say no, and keep local time.
